goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata (pdf 525kB)
indicator_name: (a) Number of commercial bank branches per 100,000 adults and (b) number of automated teller machines (ATMs) per 100,000 adults
target: Strengthen the capacity of domestic financial institutions to encourage and expand access to banking, insurance and financial services for all
graph_title: (a) Number of commercial bank branches per 100,000 adults and (b) number of automated teller machines (ATMs) per 100,000 adults
page_content:
Confirmed data exists in part for this indicator. According to the IMF Financial Survey,
there were 35.6 bank branches per 100,000 population in 2016. At year-end 2015, there
were 194 ATMs and 82 bank branches nationwide, according to information from the
Ministry of Finance and Economic Affairs.
